column4: is there a way to run MAC software and open MAC files on Ubuntu?
I know you can mount udf floppies and cds under ubuntu, and depending on the file, linux should be able to read them...
as for mac emulation for apps (like wine for windows stuff)... not sure of any such tools :P
if you can give me a moment, I can poke around and see what's there for mac emulation...
ok
specifically, what app were you trying to run?
because many of the 'base' tools are now the same (seeing that OS X is based upon BSD)
I see a couple mac OS9 emulators out there for linux, but that's about it
i am trying to run a 3rd party client for Tencent QQ, the linux versions don't work and are out of date, so my only option is the mac version
where do i find them?
reading the wiki on that app, give me a moment
there's a gaim plugin for it :)
http://openq.sourceforge.net/
i tried that, it doesn't work
there's also a native linux client, it appears - http://sourceforge.net/projects/evaq
wanted to try that, but there is no linux install file for it, just a source, and i am new at linux, so i can't use that
finally, if all that doesn't work... you should be able to use Wine to use the 'official' Windows client
it's not cpompatible with wine
the official windows version crashes before it loads when i use it with wine
what error does it kick out, if any?
no errors with wine, but the app it self kicks out an error, but the message is in Chinese, and i don't know much Chinese, i know very little, and i am using their English version.
